text: Veljko Bulajić (22 March 1928 - 3 April 2024) was a Croatian Montenegrin movie director. Bulajić was a resistance fighter in World War II having joined the Yugoslav Partisans group at the age of 13. Some of his best known movies were Kozara and Battle of Neretva. According to the Croatian Public Broadcasting Company, his movies have reached an audience of 500 million viewers worldwide. The top four most viewed Yugoslav films of all time were all directed by Bulajic. Bulajić died on 3 April 2024 in Zagreb, Croatia at the age of 96. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1928 births Category:2024 deaths Category:Croatian movie directors Category:Montenegrin people
